form.official-title: To amend title 36, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish a flag for next of kin of veterans who die by suicide.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Andrew Thomas McCaffrey Green Star Veterans Service Act.

section.header: Green Star Service Flag for next of kin of veterans deceased as result of suicide

subsection.text: Chapter 9 of title 36, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:
The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall design and designate a flag as the Green Star Service Flag to identify next of kin of covered veterans.

subsection.header: Individuals entitled To display Green Star Service Flag
subsection.text: An individual who is next of kin of a covered veteran may display the Green Star Service Flag.

Any person may apply to the Secretary for a license to manufacture and sell the designated Green Star Service Flag. A person that manufactures a Green Star Service Flag without having first obtained a license or otherwise violates this section is liable to the United States for a civil penalty of not more than $1,000.

paragraph.text: The term covered veteran means a veteran who died—
The term next of kin includes—

subparagraph.text: a family member, as that term is defined in section 1720K of title 38; and
any individual specified by the Secretary in regulations prescribed pursuant to this section.
